channel.title: Linux Questions
channel.description:
I'm using windows xp right now and I saw in another post about how you can install linux on a windows computer... I was wondering if it would be a good idea for me to do it or not? Also here are the specs of my computer..
[b]Processor:[/b]
AMD TurionTM 64x2 Dual-Core Mobile technology TL-56 Processor AMD TurionTM 64x2 Dual-Core Mobile technology TL-50 Processor AMD TurionTM 64 Mobile technology MK-36 Processor Mobile AMD SempronTM 3500+ Processor
[b] Operating System:[/b]
Windows XP Home Edition
[b] Graphics: [/b]
15.4" WXGA (1280x800) display with optional TrueLifeTM ATI Radeon® Xpress 1150 256MB HyperMemoryTM (integrated)12
[b] Hard Drive [/b]
Up to 80GB1314 5400 RPM SATA hard drive
And i got 1gb of ram... So tell me if you think its a good idea or not and if you do i'm going to need help with like were to get it and how to install.

item.title: Linux Questions
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Mr.Chris:

Good luck playing games for Windows on Ubuntu…

He mentioned WoW, which is pretty much the best supported Windows-only game on Linux.
Not sure about CS1.6, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Questions
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I have Kubuntu, Arch linux and Windows vista (WE ALL KNOW HOW MUCH MEMORY THAT HOGS), and my computer runs perfectly fine.

Mr.Chris:

Good luck playing games for Windows on Ubuntu…

WINE, imo.

Even still thats why he is planning on setting it up on a dual boot.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Questions
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

[quote=".Flair, post:14, topic:144878"]I got my Live CDs tonight, so far I like Ubuntu

I prefer the Live CDs because you can boot off of them, rather than installing on your computer (Even though I’m going to soon anyway)[/quote]
I hope you realize live CDs load key parts of the OS into RAM, and loads everything else from the CD whenever it’s needed. Therefor Ubuntu is very slow compared to an installed version…I think any files you create are lost if you reboot as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Questions
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

[quote=“Schizzo, post:4, topic:144878”]Yea, it will work perfectly fine on your computer. The minimum amount of RAM is 128 MB and you’re way past that. If you want, you can keep Windows XP on your computer and install another Linux distro too, it’s called dual booting (if you didn’t know). The only two Linux thingys that I know anything about are Ubuntu and Kubuntu. Ron made a great guide on how to dual boot with either of those, you can find the guide here.

Thank you for all the information and i think I’m going to order it!

xxlegitxx no thats one.

You can download the .iso install file to burn from a CD and install either of them that way or you can order CD’s. Both Ubuntu and Kubuntu install CD’s are free. You can order a free Ubuntu CD here and you can order a free Kbuntu CD here. You can also check out other Linux distros if you want, those are just the two I’m suggesting.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Questions
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

So from my understanding, you have four processors?

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Questions
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Yea, it will work perfectly fine on your computer. The minimum amount of RAM is 128 MB and you’re way past that. If you want, you can keep Windows XP on your computer and install another Linux distro too, it’s called dual booting (if you didn’t know). The only two Linux thingys that I know anything about are Ubuntu and Kubuntu. Ron made a great guide on how to dual boot with either of those, you can find the guide here.

You can download the .iso install file to burn from a CD and install either of them that way or you can order CD’s. Both Ubuntu and Kubuntu install CD’s are free. You can order a free Ubuntu CD here and you can order a free Kbuntu CD here. You can also check out other Linux distros if you want, those are just the two I’m suggesting.

Read full topic

item.description:

Yea i googled and you can download it straight from the site… But How much RAM will it take?? It can’t take too much because 1 of my games takes about 500 or more. (WoW , CS 1.6 )
